greeting.title: Welcome to the Science section
greeting.p1: Scientific work at the University is carried out by faculty, graduate students, doctoral candidates and students, aimed at developing research thinking among staff and students, solving current medical, humanitarian, socio-economic, pedagogical and other fundamental and applied problems, and improving the cultural and professional level of graduates.
greeting.p2: Scientific work is one of the main activities of the management and teaching staff. It is carried out to further develop the theoretical foundations of the disciplines studied, ensure organic unity of teaching, methodological and scientific work, and improve the entire educational process.
greeting.p3: The focus of scientific work should meet the needs of the current stage of social development, correspond to the profile of the University and its structural units, and contribute to the full realization of the creative potential of faculty and students.

priorities.title: Priority research areas
priorities.item1: scientific, methodological and informational support of the educational process, including training of scientific-medical personnel in licensed scientific specialties;
priorities.item2: theoretical-methodological and applied research of current cultural, humanitarian, socio-economic, pedagogical and other problems.

scientificCouncil.description: Permanent advisory body coordinating research activities and training of scientific and pedagogical staff.
scientificCouncil.title: Scientific and Technical Council
scientificCouncil.subtitle: Permanent advisory body of the University
scientificCouncil.generalText: The Scientific and Technical Council is a permanent advisory body of 'Salymbekov University'. In its activities, the STC is guided by the regulatory legal acts of the Kyrgyz Republic; the University Charter, this Regulation and other local regulations. The STC Regulation is approved by the decision of the Academic Council. The STC composition is approved by the rector's order for the academic year no later than September 30 based on the proposal of the vice-rector for scientific work on the basis of proposals from department heads. STC decisions on issues within its competence are advisory in nature.
scientificCouncil.goalsText: The purpose of the STC is to organize and coordinate activities when considering issues related to the implementation of state policy in the field of science and technology; development and improvement of the level of scientific research and innovation activities carried out in departments and other units, increasing the efficiency of training highly qualified scientific and pedagogical personnel (doctors and candidates of sciences) and student research work.
tasks: Development by University scientists of priority areas of science and technology, increasing the role of university science in accelerating scientific and technological progress, ensuring effective use of the intellectual and scientific potential of the University, creating necessary conditions for its stable development.
Ensuring priority development of fundamental and exploratory research in priority areas of research development and work with intellectual property.
Improving planning and organizational forms of research work, etc.

Development of proposals and measures to preserve the scientific potential of the University, develop scientific and pedagogical teams, train highly qualified scientific and pedagogical personnel (doctors and candidates of sciences).
Promoting integration processes between the University and scientific organizations.
Promoting the development of student research work.
Development of proposals and measures for information support of scientific research.
Preparation of proposals and recommendations for using research results in the educational process.
Analysis and evaluation of main results of scientific research and development carried out at the University.
Preparation of proposals for creation and reorganization of scientific and innovative structures, updating scientific equipment.

bioethics.description: The University Bioethics Committee is a public and independent expert body separate from the researcher and sponsor, designed to provide independent expertise, consultation, monitoring and decision-making on ethical assessment of clinical and biomedical research involving humans and/or animals to protect dignity, interests, and health rights of research participants.
bioethics.title: Bioethics Committee
bioethics.subtitle: Independent ethical review of scientific research
bioethics.descText: The University Bioethics Committee is a public and independent expert body separate from the researcher and sponsor, designed to provide independent expertise, consultation, monitoring and decision-making on ethical assessment of clinical and biomedical research involving humans and/or animals to protect dignity, interests, and health rights of research participants and patients. In its activities, the Ethics Committee is guided by the current regulatory legal acts of the Kyrgyz Republic and the university, as well as basic international norms regulating clinical and biomedical research involving humans and animals.
bioethics.chairmanDesc: Batyraliev Talantbek Abdullaevich - President of the Association of Medical Workers of the Kyrgyz Republic, professor, Doctor of Medical Sciences, active member of the American College of Cardiology. Specialist in angioplasty, one of the safest methods of treating coronary heart disease and preventing myocardial infarctions. Graduated with honors from KSMA named after Akhunbaev. Then there was postgraduate study in Moscow at the All-Union Cardiology Scientific Center and defense of candidate and doctoral dissertations. Today Talantbek Batyraliev is among the top five best cardiologists in the world.

leadership.label: Vice Chairman
leadership.value: Tulekeev T.M., Dr. Med. Sci., prof.

bioethics.tasksTitle: Main Tasks of the Ethics Committee
tasks: Protection of rights, dignity, interests, safety and health of clinical research participants, as well as monitoring compliance with patient rights when receiving medical care in university clinics
Solving moral and ethical problems related to publication of research results, including problems of plagiarism, unreliability of research results, compliance with copyright
Regulation of ethical issues of research work, clinical trials of medicines based on adopted regulatory documents

Compliance with international and national standards for approbation and implementation of new diagnostic, treatment and prevention technologies, new medicines in clinical departments of the university

Achieving independent and objective assessment of safety and inviolability of human rights in relation to subjects, both at the planning stage and during the research, as well as compliance of the research with humanistic and ethical norms
Ensuring quick and clear information to relevant organizations about any adverse reactions during the research, if necessary delaying or completely stopping clinical research
Identification of cases of violation of principles of medical ethics and deontology by medical, scientific and other university employees when providing medical services in healthcare
bioethics.functionsTitle: Main Functions and Areas of Committee Activity
functions: Conducting ethical review of research projects planned to be conducted on university premises by internal or external scientific teams

Conducting qualitative ethical review of materials of planned clinical research of medicines or medical devices, new diagnostic and treatment methods to protect subjects from possible negative consequences
Analysis of ethical justification of clinical and biomedical research and expected effectiveness and safety of studied medicines, medical devices, medical technologies
Preparation of conclusions on feasibility of conducting clinical and biomedical research, as well as monitoring compliance with dignity, rights and safety of research subjects
Monitoring compliance with ethical and legal norms during clinical research and constant dynamic monitoring of the course of clinical research
Monitoring compliance with principles of medical ethics and deontology by medical, scientific and other university employees when providing medical services in healthcare
Studying and applying international experience of legal and ethical regulation when conducting clinical and biomedical research
Organization and conduct of scientific-theoretical and practical events on bioethical issues
Participation in ethical and legal education of medical workers and citizens in the field of human rights protection during clinical and biomedical research
Participation in expert assessment of advertising of medical and pharmaceutical activities, as well as goods and services violating citizens' rights to health protection
Development and implementation of various methods of ethical education of university employees and monitoring staff compliance with ethical norms

youngScientists.description: The Young Scientists Council (hereinafter YSC) of ¬´Salymbekov University¬ª is a public organization formed from among teachers, researchers, graduate students and undergraduates of all structural divisions of the university under the age of 35.
youngScientists.title: Young Scientists Council
youngScientists.subtitle: Development of scientific potential of young researchers
youngScientists.generalText: The Young Scientists Council (hereinafter YSC) of ¬´Salymbekov University¬ª is a public organization formed from among teachers, researchers, graduate students and undergraduates of all structural divisions of the university under the age of 35. The YSC composition is approved by the rector of ¬´Salymbekov University¬ª. The activities of the YSC are financed from the own funds of ¬´Salymbekov University¬ª as a separate line in the "Scientific Activity" section of the income and expenditure estimate of ¬´Salymbekov University¬ª, from sponsorship receipts from enterprises, organizations, other legal entities and individuals.
youngScientists.goalsTitle: Goals and objectives of the Young Scientists Council
youngScientists.goalsText: The YSC is created with the aim of promoting the realization of the creative potential of young scientists and teachers of the university. The YSC combines the efforts of young scientists in developing priority areas and topics of scientific research, and promotes that their results become the property of the wider scientific community. The YSC summarizes the positive experience of scientific, methodological and pedagogical work of young scientists and teachers, and comes up with initiatives for its implementation in production and the educational process. The YSC promotes the activation of interdisciplinary research, for this purpose it maintains contacts and interaction with the scientific youth of higher educational institutions and scientific institutions of the republic.

contents.eurasian_forum_sian_2025: The Eurasian Forum in Xian 2025 is a large-scale international event dedicated to the development of cooperation between Eurasian countries in the fields of education, science and technology. The university actively participated in the forum, presenting its educational programs and scientific developments.
contents.k_hospital_fair_2025: üåç‚ú® Salymbekov University ‚Äî opening new horizons in world medicine! From September 17-19, 2025, teachers from the Higher School of Medicine of Salymbekov University participated in K-HOSPITAL + HealthTech FAIR in Seoul, Republic of Korea. üá∞üá∑ This is a large-scale international exhibition where leading doctors, scientists and experts from around the world meet to exchange experiences and discover new horizons in medicine. Our teachers: üîπ got acquainted with the latest innovations and medical technologies; üîπ established valuable international connections; üîπ discussed the prospects for applying new solutions in the educational process and healthcare of Kyrgyzstan. Participation in such prestigious events is not just a step forward for the university, it is a contribution to the future of medicine in our country. üåêüí° Salymbekov University continues to expand international horizons and form a new generation of doctors ready for the challenges of tomorrow. ü©∫‚ú®
contents.europe_central_asia_cooperation_2025: Today in Bishkek started the international conference 'Strengthening Cooperation between Universities of Europe and Central Asia: Empowerment through Joint Programs, Research and Academic Mobility', organized by the National Erasmus+ Office in the Kyrgyz Republic and the Ministry of Education and Science of the KR. Co-organizers: Salymbekov University, Kyrgyz State Technical University named after I. Razzakov and Adam University. April 23-24, 2025 Park Hotel, 87 Orozbekov St., Bishkek. The conference brings together about 50 participants from Central Asia and Europe: teachers, researchers, Erasmus+ experts and educational policy developers. Goals: development of international cooperation, modernization of curricula, strengthening research, improving teaching and expanding student mobility. Special attention to sustainable development and 'green' skills. Join us in creating the future of higher education!
contents.interuniversity_conference_2024: On November 14, students of the Higher School of Medicine of Salymbekov University - Momna Javed and Fahad Ali Nawaz - took part in an interuniversity scientific conference dedicated to 'World Diabetes Day'. At the invitation of the Asian Medical Institute named after S. Tentishev, our students presented reports on the topic 'Molecular Mechanisms of Diabetes Treatment and Prevention'. For their active participation and interesting research, they were awarded certificates. We are proud of our students' achievements and their contribution to the fight against diabetes!
contents.science_day_conference_2024: On November 14, a scientific conference dedicated to Science Day was held at the Higher School of Medicine of Salymbekov University! Scientific discussions were conducted in three languages: Kyrgyz, Russian and English, uniting all participants! The conference was divided into two sections - for local and foreign students, each of whom presented their scientific reports. Each participant was awarded certificates and gifts from our university, and the best received branded diaries as memorable prizes. We are proud that all works were performed at a high level! Dear students, you are true talents! Keep striving for new heights!
contents.naryn_education_horizons_2024: An educational training was held in Naryn region! On November 5-6, a training for school directors, mathematics and Kyrgyz language teachers of general education schools of Naryn region took place. The event was organized by the Plenipotentiary Representative of the President in Naryn region, Naryn Regional Methodological Educational Center and the Education and Innovation Center of Salymbekov University. The purpose of the event was to improve preparation for nationwide testing and develop strategic plans. The training was attended by 138 school directors, 141 mathematics teachers and 140 Kyrgyz language teachers.
contents.creative_industries_delegation_2024: Salymbekov University, as part of the Creative Industries Association delegation, participated in the IV World Conference on Creative Economy, which took place in Tashkent from October 2-4. The conference brought together more than 2,000 leaders and representatives of creative industries from more than 80 countries to discuss the future of the creative economy and the impact of the latest technologies on its development. The program included plenary sessions, discussions on creative entrepreneurship, digitalization and sustainable development, as well as master classes from leading world experts.
contents.international_conference_summer_2024: An international seminar-conference on 'Modern Methods of Diagnosing and Treating Cancer' was held at Salymbekov University. The event was organized jointly by Salymbekov University and Qiqihar Medical University from China. Participants of the seminar were teachers, doctors and students of Salymbekov University, who actively participated in discussions and exchange of experience. The following speakers presented the latest research and cancer treatment methods: 1. Professor Rysbek Abyldaev - Vice President and Professor of Salymbekov University. 2. Zhang Keyong - Deputy Secretary of CPC, Qiqihar Medical University, China 3. Han Fangbao - Director of Qiqihar Foreign Affairs Office, China (online) 4. Li Chunxu - Director of Hospital Management Department, Qiqihar Medical University, China 5. Wu Ligang - Secretary of CPC, Director of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Qiqihar Medical University, China (online) 6. Li Xingjiang - Director of Pathology Department, Qiqihar Medical University, China (online) 7. Wang Jingchun - Deputy Director of International Exchange and Cooperation Department, Qiqihar Medical University, China (online) 8. Liu Bo - Deputy Director of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Qiqihar Medical University, China (online) 9. Yang Yu - Deputy Director of the Third Affiliated Hospital of Qiqihar Medical University, China (online). The seminar was an important event for knowledge and experience exchange in oncology. Participants were able to discuss current problems and prospects for the development of cancer diagnosis and treatment, as well as establish fruitful contacts for future cooperation.
contents.autumn_science_conference_2023: An interuniversity scientific conference 'Medical Education and Humanities' was held at the International Faculty of Medicine! Students and representatives from different universities shared their research and reports, creating an atmosphere of fascinating knowledge exchange. We thank everyone who participated and contributed to enriching medical science and humanitarian aspects in this field.
contents.student_parliament_news_2023: News from the Student Parliament of the International College of IT and Business of Salymbekov University! Students announce the launch of a unique project - the Guinness Book of Records at Salymbekov University. In this project, each of our students will be able to show their talent and participate in creating records in the following categories: üîπIT record üîπSports üîπEducation üîπCreativity üîπActivity
contents.turkey_residency_cooperation_2023: Resident of the urology department of the University Clinic named after Necmettin Erbakan Nurmanbek Turaliev gave a lecture for students of the medical faculty. simulation.title: Simulation Center
simulation.description: Modern equipment for practical training of future medical professionals

description: Practical classes are equipped with visual aids, models of body parts and organs, posters for conducting visual practical classes. Through simulation materials and preparations, communication skills, diagnostic techniques, and algorithms of actions in unforeseen situations are mastered.

The center practices basic and advanced skills and abilities in surgery, obstetrics, gynecology, urology and many other medical specialties that have a practical component, and conducts team interaction training.

The hall presents preparations of all body systems: musculoskeletal, cardiovascular, nervous, digestive and others. Special attention is paid to topographic anatomy and mutual arrangement of organs.

The laboratory allows conducting research in the fields of enzymology, metabolism, molecular biology and disease diagnostics.

pH meters and ionometers for acidity measurement

socialSupport.title: Commission for Social Support of Students
socialSupport.subtitle: System of providing benefits and social guarantees to support students in achieving high educational results
provisions: The Regulation is developed based on the Charter of the Institution "Salymbekov University" (hereinafter the University), the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic "On Education" and other regulatory legal acts governing the activities of higher professional educational institutions.

This Regulation is developed for the purpose of social support for students and enhancing motivation of students to achieve high educational results, as well as providing additional social guarantees to certain categories of students of the University.

This Regulation establishes a unified system for providing tuition fee benefits for students who are citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic, studying at the University on a contract basis, and defines the procedure, types and terms for providing benefits to certain categories of students of the University.
Social support for students represents the provision of benefits to students in the form of reducing the cost of tuition by an amount expressed as a percentage of the established tuition cost.

supportCategories.description: Reduction of tuition cost in percentage terms

supportCategories.description: Subsidized meals in the university cafeteria

supportCategories.title: Payment Deferral
supportCategories.description: Installment payment of tuition in the absence of debts

supportCategories.title: Special Cases
supportCategories.description: Support in exceptional situations by decision of the commission

supportCategories.title: Social Guarantees
supportCategories.description: Additional support measures for certain categories

procedureSteps.title: Commission Decision
procedureSteps.content: The University provides social support to students and grants them tuition fee benefits based on the decision of a special commission created and headed by the President of the University.

procedureSteps.title: Approval by Founders
procedureSteps.content: All forms of social support, including tuition fee benefits, are considered by a special commission and submitted for approval to the founders of the University.

procedureSteps.title: Financial Capabilities
procedureSteps.content: The procedure, types and amounts of social support provided to students of the University are determined independently based on the financial capabilities of the University.

procedureSteps.title: Deferral and Installment
procedureSteps.content: Social support may be provided to students of the University in the form of deferral or installment payment of tuition upon submission by the heads of academic departments of faculties and in the absence of academic and financial debts for tuition payment for previous semesters.

studentCouncil.councilRegulation: Regulation on the Student Council of Salymbekov University
generalProvisionsItems: 1.1. The Student Council of the Salymbekov University (hereinafter - the Student Council) is an elected representative body of student self-government that represents the interests of students in academic, scientific, cultural, sports, and public life.

1.2. The Student Council is established to ensure the realization of students' rights to participate in the management of the educational process, address important issues of student life, develop their social activity, and support and implement social initiatives.

1.3. The Student Council in its activities is guided by the Constitution of the Kyrgyz Republic, the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic "On Education", the University Charter, this Regulation, and other local regulatory acts of the University.
1.4. The Student Council carries out its activities on the principles of voluntariness, equality, self-government, legality, and transparency.
studentCouncil.mainTasks: 2. Main Tasks of the Student Council
mainTasksItems: 2.1. Representing student interests before the University administration;
2.2. Assisting in organizing the educational process and improving education quality;
2.3. Organizing cultural, sports, and scientific events;
2.4. Developing volunteer movement and social projects;
2.5. Assisting in solving social and everyday issues of students;
2.6. Organizing student leisure and developing creative potential;
2.7. Assisting in preventing offenses among students;
2.8. Participating in decisions related to scholarship appointments;
2.9. Assisting in graduate employment;
2.10. Cooperating with other student organizations.
functionsItems: 3.1. Participating in developing and implementing University development programs;
3.3. Representing student interests in various commissions and councils;
3.6. Organizing work of student clubs and associations;
rightsItems: 4.1. To make proposals for improving the educational process and student living conditions;
4.2. To participate in developing local regulatory acts affecting student interests;
4.3. To organize and conduct cultural and sports events;
4.4. To represent student interests in various University commissions and councils;
4.5. To receive necessary information from the University administration to fulfill its tasks;
4.6. To create commissions and working groups to solve specific tasks;
4.7. To participate in distributing funds allocated for student events;
4.8. To make proposals for rewarding students for active participation.
organizationItems: 5.1. The Student Council is elected at a general student meeting for a term of one year.
5.2. The Student Council includes representatives from each course and faculty.
5.3. The Student Council is headed by a chairperson elected from among the council members.
5.4. Student Council meetings are held at least once a month.
5.5. Student Council decisions are made by majority vote of present members.
5.6. The Student Council reports on its activities to the general student meeting.
5.7. The University administration provides assistance in the Student Council's activities.

studentCouncil.councilRegulation: Regulation on the Student Council of Salymbekov University
generalProvisionsItems: 1.1. The Student Council of Salymbekov University (hereinafter - the Student Council) is an elected representative body of student self-government, representing the interests of students in the fields of academic, scientific, cultural, sports and public life.

1.2. The Student Council is created to ensure the realization of students' rights to participate in the management of the educational process, to solve important issues of student life, to develop their social activity, support and implementation of social initiatives.

1.3. The Student Council in its activities is guided by the Constitution of the Kyrgyz Republic, the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic "On Education", the University Charter, this Regulation and other local normative acts of the University.
1.4. The Student Council carries out its activities based on the principles of voluntariness, equality, self-government, legality and transparency.
studentCouncil.mainTasks: 2. Main Tasks of the Student Council
mainTasksItems: 2.1. Representing students' interests to the University administration;
2.2. Assisting in organizing the educational process and improving education quality;
2.3. Organizing cultural, sports and scientific events;
2.4. Developing volunteer movement and social projects;
2.5. Assisting in solving social and everyday issues of students;
2.6. Organizing student leisure and developing creative potential;
2.7. Assisting in preventing violations among students;
2.8. Participating in decisions related to scholarship appointments;
2.9. Assisting in graduate employment;
2.10. Interacting with other student organizations.
functionsItems: 3.1. Participating in the development and implementation of University development programs;
3.3. Representing students' interests in various committees and councils;
3.6. Organizing the work of student clubs and associations;
rightsItems: 4.1. Submit proposals to improve the educational process and student life organization;
4.2. Participate in the development of local normative acts affecting students' interests;
4.3. Organize and conduct cultural and sports events;
4.4. Represent students' interests in various University committees and councils;
4.5. Receive necessary information from the University administration to perform its tasks;
4.6. Create commissions and working groups to solve specific tasks;
4.7. Participate in the distribution of funds allocated for student events;
4.8. Submit proposals for rewarding students for active participation.
organizationItems: 5.1. The Student Council is elected at the general student meeting for a term of one year.
5.2. The Student Council consists of representatives from each course and faculty.
5.3. The Student Council is led by a chairman elected from among the council members.
5.4. Student Council meetings are held at least once a month.
5.5. Student Council decisions are made by a majority vote of attending members.
5.6. The Student Council reports on its activities to the general student meeting.
5.7. The University administration supports the activities of the Student Council.

page.title: Student Scientific Society
page.subtitle: Association of students engaged in research activities

items.text: The Student Scientific Society of Salymbekov University (hereinafter referred to as SSS) is a public organization that unites students of the University on a voluntary basis who show an inclination for scientific-organizational and research work, actively participate in scientific-organizational and research work, and are members of student scientific circles at departments.

Any student of the University engaged in research work as part of a scientific circle (seminar, working group, etc.) or individually participating in the preparation of reports, abstracts, presentations, and conducting scientific research has the right to be a member of the SSS.

The activities of the SSS are supervised by the Council of Young Scientists (CYS) of the University and builds its work in cooperation with the University Council for SRW, deputy deans of faculties for science and departments, and other structural subdivisions of the University.

The SSS carries out its activities in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic, the University Charter, orders of the rector, vice-rectors, directives of the CYS, these Regulations, and documents adopted in accordance with them.

The SSS carries out its activities on the principles of self-government, open nature of activities, voluntariness, equality, legality, spirit of mutual respect, and culture of scientific communication among students.

The SSS, in accordance with these Regulations, may join international public associations, acquire rights and bear obligations corresponding to the status of these international public associations, maintain international contacts and connections, conclude agreements with foreign non-profit non-governmental educational and scientific associations, foreign educational institutions, and scientific institutions.

socialSupport.title: Student Social Support Commission
socialSupport.subtitle: System of benefits and social guarantees to support students in achieving higher education results
provisions: The Regulation is developed based on the Charter of Salymbekov University institution (hereinafter - University), the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic 'On Education', and other regulatory legal acts governing the activities of higher professional educational institutions.

This Regulation is developed to provide social support to students and strengthen motivation for achieving higher education results, as well as to provide additional social guarantees to certain categories of University students.

This Regulation establishes a unified system of tuition fee benefits for students studying at the University on a contract basis who are citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic, and defines the procedure, types, and terms for granting benefits to certain categories of University students.
Social support for students consists of providing benefits to students in the form of tuition fee reduction expressed as a percentage of the established tuition fee.

supportCategories.title: Tuition Fee Benefits
supportCategories.description: Percentage reduction in tuition fee

supportCategories.title: Free Accommodation
supportCategories.description: Provision of free places in dormitory

supportCategories.title: Affordable Meals
supportCategories.description: Subsidized meals at university cafeteria

supportCategories.title: Payment Deferrals
supportCategories.description: Installment payment of tuition fee in absence of debts

supportCategories.description: Support in special circumstances based on commission decision

supportCategories.title: Social Guarantees
supportCategories.description: Additional support measures for certain categories

procedureSteps.title: Commission Decision
procedureSteps.content: The university provides social support to students and grants them tuition fee benefits based on the decision of a special commission created and headed by the University President.

procedureSteps.title: Founder Approval
procedureSteps.content: All forms of social support, including tuition fee benefits, are considered by a special commission and submitted for approval to the University's founders.

procedureSteps.title: Financial Capabilities
procedureSteps.content: The procedure, types, and amounts of social support provided to University students are independently determined depending on the University's financial capabilities.

procedureSteps.title: Deferrals and Installments
procedureSteps.content: University students may be provided social support in the form of payment deferrals or installment payments in the absence of academic and financial debts for tuition fee payment for previous semesters, based on the recommendation of the heads of faculty academic departments.

additionalInfo.title: Regulation on Student Social Support
additionalInfo.description: The full text of the Regulation is available on the university's official website for review. The document contains all details and procedures for providing social support.

kachibek.forum1: Salymbekov University on the international scientific arena! Doctor of Medical Sciences, Professor Uzakbaev Kamchibek Askarbekovich participated in the International Eurasian Forum held in Xi'an city (PRC) within the 'One Belt, One Road' initiative.
kachibek.forum2: Within the forum, a conference on traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) was held, devoted to modern challenges and achievements in this field. At the medicine section, the professor presented a report on the development of TCM in Kyrgyzstan and its spread in Central Asian countries.
kachibek.forum3: During the visit, agreements were signed with the Xi'an City Healthcare Committee on exchange of scientific research and personnel training. The delegation also visited pharmaceutical enterprises and TCM hospitals, where high effectiveness of traditional Chinese medicine methods in treating brain diseases was demonstrated.
kachibek.forum4: This cooperation opens new horizons for medicine development and strengthening scientific ties between Kyrgyzstan and China.

simulation.title: Simulation Center
simulation.description: Modern equipment for practical training of future medical professionals

description: Classrooms for practical classes are equipped with visual aids, models of body parts and organs, and posters for conducting visual practical classes. Communication skills, diagnostic techniques, and action algorithms in emergency situations are mastered through simulation materials and preparations.

The center develops basic and in-depth skills and knowledge in surgery, obstetrics, gynecology, urology, and many other medical specialties with practical parts, and conducts team interaction training.

features.title: Practical Skills
features.description: Working on medical manipulations on modern simulators

equipment: Phantoms and mannequins for skill development
Video systems for recording and analysis

anatomy.title: Anatomy Hall
anatomy.description: Study of human body structure on modern anatomical preparations

description: The anatomy hall is equipped with modern study preparations, skeletons, models, and visual aids for detailed study of human body structure. Here, students acquire basic knowledge in anatomy necessary for further study of clinical disciplines.

The hall displays preparations of all body systems: limb skeleton, cardiovascular system, nervous system, digestive system, and others. Special attention is paid to topographic anatomy and the mutual arrangement of organs.

page.title: Student Scientific Society
page.subtitle: Public organization for students interested in scientific research work

items.text: The Student Scientific Society of Salymbekov University institution (hereinafter - SSS) is a public organization that voluntarily unites University students who have aptitudes for scientific-organizational and research work, actively participate in scientific-organizational and research work, and are members of departmental student scientific circles.

Any University student of various specialties who is engaged in scientific research work as part of a scientific circle (seminar, working group, etc.) or individually participates in preparing reports, abstracts, presentations, and conducting scientific research has the right to be a member of the SSS.

The SSS's activity is formed and coordinated by the University's Young Scientists Council (YSC) and operates in cooperation with the University's SRW Council, vice-deans for science of faculties and departments, as well as other structural units of the University.

The SSS carries out its activity in accordance with the laws of the Kyrgyz Republic, the University's Charter, orders of the rector, vice-rectors, regulations of the YSC, this Regulation, and documents adopted in accordance with it.

The SSS carries out its activity based on the principles of self-government, openness of activity, freedom, equality, legality, mutual respect, and the spirit of students' scientific communication culture.

The SSS has the right to join international public associations in accordance with this Regulation, to obtain rights and perform duties in accordance with the statutes of these international public associations, to maintain international connections and contacts, and to conclude agreements with foreign non-commercial, non-governmental educational and scientific associations, with foreign educational institutions and scientific institutions.
